page.title: 08EDUCATION IN THE AREA (2)
page.content: {BROCKWORTH COUNTY JUNIOR SCHOOL}was built 34 years ago to accommodate the increasing child population as the village grew after the War.The Infant children moved to a new school on the same site in 1955 .The school caters for 250 children and 8 full time and 6 part time teaching staff.There are 12 classrooms,8 being occupied full time. The age of pupils ranges from 7 to 11 years.The catchment area is almost wholly Brockworth Village. There are two classes of mixed ability in each year,consequently group teaching predominates.There is a broad and varied curriculum with accent on Language development,Maths. and Science.Other features are Music and Educational Visits,including Educ. Holidays.The school supports several charities.There is a strong P.T.A.
